attributes.action: introduce in the forthcoming UK election, and for all future elections, a ‘Vote of no confidence’ box should be added to the ballot form/slip
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: We the undersigned put forward the proposition that in the forthcoming UK election, and for all future elections, a ‘Vote of no confidence’ box should be introduced to the ballot form/slip. This would allow people who wish to exercise their right to vote but see no clear distinction between the existing parties, or just wish to voice their discontent at the current state of politics in this country, to register their democratic opinion. In the past various parties have blamed low turn-out to the voting polls on ‘public apathy’. This may not be the case. We believe the ‘Vote of no confidence’ box would remove this ambiguity, allowing the government a clearer perspective of the public's changing attitudes, while also granting the hitherto silent voice of those wishing to abstain from voting for a particular party, to be heard.
